body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Places To Go             Places To Go        Close-up of the Ocracoke Lighthouse National Park Service       There are a great many places to visit along the entire stretch of Cape Hatteras National Seashore. Stop by one of our visitor centers for orientation information or ranger programs. Visit one or more of the three lighthouses that have aided sailors navigating the treacherous waters just offshore. Interested in enjoying the beach? There are bathhouses on each island as well!   Select a location to learn more about just a few of the places you can explore.              Bodie Island Light Station Recently renovated and opened for seasonal climbing, the Bodie Island Lighthouse provides wonderful views of Bodie Island, the Pamlico Sound, and the Atlantic Ocean.           Cape Hatteras Light Station The Cape Hatteras Lighthouse—with help from its keepers—warn ships of the dangers of the Diamond Shoals. This lighthouse is open seasonally for climbs.              Ocracoke Light Station Ocracoke Lighthouse is the oldest operating lighthouse in North Carolina. While the lighthouse is not open for climbing, you can still stop by and take a look at this signal that welcomes sailors to a safe harbor.           Visitor Centers Stop by one of the visitor centers to get orientation information, sign up for a ranger program, or learn more about the history and resources of Cape Hatteras National Seashore.            US Weather Bureau Station The Hatteras Island US Weather Bureau Station was constructed in the early 1900s and was home to meteorologists studying regional weather conditions. Now, the station is home to a visitor contact station operated by the Outer Banks Visitors Bureau.
title: Cape Hatteras National Seashore: Places To Go
